required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Urine Levels of Metanephrin and Normetanephrin in Patients With Frequent Ventricular Premature Complex
clinical_study.official_title: Urine Levels of Metanephrin and Normetanephrin in Patients With Frequent Ventricular Premature Complex

brief_summary.textblock: Enhanced automaticity process is the underlying mechanism for arrhythmias due to excess catecholamines. Catecholamines may increase in patients with PVC. Metabolites of catecholamines are metanephrine and normetanephrine. Our aim is to measure 24 hours urine levels of metanephrine and normetanephrine.

detailed_description.textblock: Premature ventricular complex is a very frequent arrhythmia. Suggested mechanisms for PVCs are reentry, triggered activity, and enhanced automaticity. Enhanced automaticity process is the underlying mechanism for arrhythmias due to excess catecholamines. Catecholamines may increase in patients with PVC. Half-lives of catecholamines are very short and rather changeable. Therefore, 24 hours urine levels of catecholamines are the more sensitive than plasma levels. Metabolites of catecholamines are metanephrine and normetanephrine. Our aim is to measure 24 hours urine levels of metanephrine and normetanephrine.

primary_outcome.description: metanephrine and normetanephrine levels asociated premature ventricular complex frequents

intervention.intervention_name: 24 hours urine levels metanephrine and normetanephrine
intervention.description: 24 hours rhythm recording and 24 hours urine measurement

study_pop.textblock: patients with % 5 or higher frequents premature ventricular complex in 24 hours rhythm recording will be taken our study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- PVC's rate is more than % 5 in 24 hours rhythm recording
Exclusion Criteria:
- ischemic heart disease
- hyperthyroidism
- patients with low ejection fraction

facility.name: Erciyes university Yilmaz- mehmet öztaşkın heart hospital

reference.citation: Im SI, Park KM, Park SJ, Kim JS, On YK. New electrocardiographic criteria for predicting successful ablation of premature ventricular contractions from the right coronary cusp. Int J Cardiol. 2016 Dec 1;224:199-205. doi: 10.1016/j.ijcard.2016.09.029. Epub 2016 Sep 16.

Bradfield JS, Homsi M, Shivkumar K, Miller JM. Coupling interval variability differentiates ventricular ectopic complexes arising in the aortic sinus of valsalva and great cardiac vein from other sources: mechanistic and arrhythmic risk implications. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2014 May 27;63(20):2151-2158. doi: 10.1016/j.jacc.2014.02.551. Epub 2014 Mar 19.
